summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the July 13, 2019 interview of Juan Alessi, a former estate manager for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach. Alessi details his employment from approximately 1989 to 2002, describing the household operations, the controlling role of Ghislaine Maxwell, the recruitment of young girls for massages, and Epstein's threatening behavior upon his departure.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.role: Former Estate Manager for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Primary interviewee who worked for Epstein from ~1989 to 2002. Describes household operations, Maxwell's role, and the arrival of young girls for massages.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Alessi's employer. Described as demanding, secretive, receiving frequent massages, and traveling with young girls. Threatened Alessi upon his departure.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Took over management of all Epstein's residences around 1993. Described as controlling and cruel. Actively recruited massage therapists and young girls, including a teenager from Mar-a-Lago.

persons.name: Maria Alessi
persons.context: Juan Alessi's wife who was hired to shop and take care of the cleaning girls. Worked alongside her husband until they both quit in 2002.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: A former customer of Alessi's repair business. Through Wexner, Epstein learned of and hired Alessi.

persons.name: Eva Anderson
persons.context: Recalled by Alessi as Epstein's girlfriend around 1993, before Ghislaine Maxwell arrived.

persons.name: Hernandez or Rodriguez
persons.context: The person Alessi believed took over his job after he left. This person later called Alessi asking how he survived working in the house.

persons.name: Jojo
persons.role: Staff for Epstein's New York Residence
persons.context: Mentioned by Alessi as someone caring for Epstein's New York residence around the time he left.

persons.name: Lynn Fontanello or Fontanelli
persons.role: Staff for Epstein's New York Residence
persons.context: Mentioned by Alessi alongside 'Jojo' as staff caring for Epstein's New York residence.

connections.description: Alessi worked as a contractor and later full-time estate manager for Epstein from ~1989 to 2002.
Maxwell became Alessi's direct supervisor around 1993, giving him orders and enforcing strict household rules.
Maxwell took over management of all Epstein's residences and was involved in recruiting girls for him.
Husband and wife who both worked for Epstein. Juan requested Maria be hired to help with household duties.
Wexner was a connection through whom Epstein learned of and hired Juan Alessi.
Maxwell recruited a teenage girl (approx. 15-16) from Mar-a-Lago who later became a regular at Epstein's house and traveled with him.

events.title: Juan Alessi Hired by Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, having learned of him through Leslie Wexner, reaches out to Juan Alessi and hires him as a part-time contractor.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Takes Over Management
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrives at the Palm Beach house and takes charge of all of Epstein's residences, instituting strict control over staff.

events.title: Recruitment of Teen Girl from Mar-a-Lago
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell has Alessi drive her to Mar-a-Lago for a massage. There, she recruits a teenage girl (~15-16) in a white uniform dress, who later becomes a regular at Epstein's house and travels with him.

events.title: Alessi and Wife Quit
events.description: Juan and Maria Alessi stop working for Jeffrey Epstein. They receive a $50,000 severance payment.

events.title: FBI Interview of Juan Alessi
events.description: Juan Alessi is interviewed by the FBI, an AUSA, and a Task Force Officer, providing detailed information about his time working for Epstein.

locations: Palm Beach, Florida (location of Epstein's house where Alessi worked)
New York (location of another Epstein residence)
New Mexico (location of another Epstein residence)
Ohio (location of another Epstein residence, likely linked to Wexner)
Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach club where Maxwell recruited a teenage girl)
Virginia (destination for Epstein's travel with the recruited girl)
England (destination for Epstein's travel with the recruited girl)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell actively recruited massage therapists and young girls for Epstein, including a teenage girl (~15-16) she approached at Mar-a-Lago in 2002.
Juan Alessi's duties included setting up a massage room, cleaning up sex toys/dildos afterward, and being instructed never to speak to or ask the ages of the young female guests.
Epstein threatened Alessi upon his departure, saying, "Juan, I hope you never open your mouth, because you can get in trouble," and all employees had to sign confidentiality agreements.
The household operation under Maxwell was described as "slavery," with staff working extremely long hours (5 AM to 10 PM) when Epstein was in town.

After the initial Palm Beach police investigation, Alessi was questioned by private investigators he believed worked for Epstein, and years later was offered $200,000 to portray himself in a movie about Epstein.
